reference.title: cxxFile
reference.shortdesc: The cxxFile element contains information about items declared in a file in C++ (for example a header file).

section.title: Description
section.p: The <cxxFile> element contains information about C++ items defined in a header file e.g. enums or typdefs
It can also contain links to other topics for items e.g. classes that have been declared in the header file
The <cxxFile> element requires an id attribute.
The <cxxFile> element must contain the file name within the element <apiname>. <cxxFile> can also contain zero or more of the following elements to describe the global information:

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <cxxFile id="afile"> <apiName>afile.h</apiName> <cxxFileDetail> <cxxFileAPIItemLocation> <cxxFileDeclarationFile name="filePath" value="C:/src/afile.h"/> </cxxFileAPIItemLocation> <apiDesc>afile.h demonstrates the simple use cxxFile and related elements.</apiDesc> </cxxFileDetail> <cxxVariable id="avar"> <apiName>AVar</apiName> <cxxVariableDetail> ... </cxxVariableDetail> </cxxVariable> </cxxFile>
